author: NFT-DAO (the whole team)
title: NFTDAO: Industry Standards 1 (dues)
description: Mainstream adoption of NFTs require standards to give organizations confidence in their long term stability and consistency.

assessments.note: The proposal does not give enough detail on what they are actually going to do
assessments.reply:
It was pretty clear what the funds are for: "This proposal seeks funds to pay yearly dues for IWA members (https://interwork.org/membership/members/)

of $5,000 as a participating member shaping the future of interoperability of NFTs."  We are joining a consortium.

assessments.note: The proposal to fund NFA  DAO for accruing membership in IWA is not addressing the core problems listed as the objectives of the challenge.
assessments.reply: The challenge objective is increasing the use of metadata, helping to set the standards works toward that goal.

assessments.note: Yes, NFT standards are important to the industry.

This proposal aims to bring the benefits of IWA membership to the cardano community, which means that the voice of the CNFT crowd can be heard withing a broad standard setting organization while also gaining the ability to use these standards. In order to drive broad adoption while also bringing reliable utility standards are absolutely necessary.

Although the goal of paying yearly dues for IWA membership is a laudable and one that should be supported so that the Cardano token community can participate in standards activities, the project doesn't directly contribute specific solutions according to the Metadata Challenge criteria. Rather it is a meta-solution.
Whilst the proposers may have useful experience, there is no detail on what is actually going to be done other than paying membership fees for the proposers in a standards group.
assessments.reply: This is correct, we are going to pay dues.  What the assessor doesn't understand is participation is how we learn industry best practices and influence industry best practices.  This is a standards implementing body Cardano needs to be present in.

assessments.note: The proposers claim experience in the field. Credentials could not be verified with the inputs provided in the proposal.
assessments.reply: The participants details and backgrounds are in the proposal.

assessments.note: Yes, the team has knowledge in the field and it is already actively working in it.
This task is simple, buy membership into a standards setting organization. there is no reason to doubt that it will happen.
The plan to pay IWA dues is clearly achievable according to the plan, and the NFTDAO team and community is clearly qualified to engage with and contribute to the IWA.

The membership is used generally by a company to push its standards into the global standards.  Cardano metadata is evolving and hence the standards are also evolving. Being a platform it is likely to support multiple standards. Hence any commercial entity which will be rolling out products is in a better position to take membership. NFT DAO with fluid-structure may not be able to represent the interest of all involved in NFT.
assessments.reply: No one person can represent totallity but having some representation is better than none and is a start of making sure Cardano is represented at the table.

assessments.note: There are general timetables to finish the work on the proposal.

this proposal's task is really just that, a task. The more difficult side of it will be gaining broad acceptance within the CNFT community, however the team has a great head start on that through the community that NFT-DAO has already become.

Auditing the payment of the IWA will be straightforward. The proposal does not provide a clear metric for its intermediate goal of "active and fully engaged and contributing"; that goal could have been quantified.

solution: Industry Standards Organizations develop standards for adoption across multiple vendor implementations, these are starting to form for NFTs.
experience: NFTDAO has over 300 contributors with differing specialities, including architects who have developed & adopted various technical standards.
